description: Students will develop a facility with fundamental 3-dimensional design concepts through the application of both computer graphics visualization and physical construction. The course will offer students a technical understanding of Polygonal and Spline based modeling, alternative and standard methods of 3-D input/output, and will cover regulations for creating models that will function properly for animation, video games and CMC/laser output.
name: 3D COMP MODLG/SCULP

values.comments:
FNAR 235 is aimed at developing students’ skills at 3D modeling. The course covers both computer graphics modeling and physical construction. Students are taught Polygonal and Spline based modeling, and alternative and standard methods of 3-D input/output. Additionally, the course covers regulations for creating models that will function properly for animation, video games and CMC/laser output. 

Students have found this class to be useful and applicable. This course covers a broad range of modeling techniques. Additionally, students have reported that this class is applicable to a wide range of disciplines including engineering, fine arts, industrial design, and architecture.

Professor White is an interesting and knowledgeable lecturer. In addition, he is friendly, patient, and willing to help students outside of the classroom. Students have also reported that they felt motivated by Professor White. One student, however, commented that they would have found it helpful if Professor White had given students feedback about their grades and standing in the class earlier in the semester.

The workload for this course is quite sizable, however students have reported that spending the required time on the assignments has been rewarding. However, students have reported that the size of the class was too large to allow the amount of individual attention that students felt would have been helpful. Prerequisites are FNAR 123 and FNAR 264.
